Description: The FCC's Enforcement Bureau announced that Comcast Corporation would pay a $2.3 million fine to resolve an investigation into whether the company wrongfully charged cable TV customers for services and equipment that those customers never authorized.
Info Source: https://apps.fcc.gov/edocs_public/attachmatch/DOC-341621A1.pdf
https://apps.fcc.gov/edocs_public/attachmatch/DOC-314879A1.pdf

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Comcast agreed to pay $900,000 to settle allegations that it violated the Do Not Call provisions of the Telemarketing Sales Rule by having telemarketers call consumers who specifically asked not to be called.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2009/04/directv-comcast-pay-total-321-million-entity-specific-do-not-call

Description: Comcast Corporation entered into a conciliation agreement with the Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs to resolve allegations of sex and race discrimination at its operation in Everett, Washington.
Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Info Source: https://www.dol.gov/newsroom/releases/ofccp/ofccp20150844

Description: The California Attorney General announced that the California Department of Justice, along with the California Public Utilities Commission, reached a $33 million settlement with Comcast over allegations that it posted online the names, phone numbers and addresses of tens of thousands of customers who had paid for unlisted voice over internet protocol (VOIP) phone service.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-kamala-d-harris-reaches-33-million-settlement-comcast-over

Description: Comcast agreed to pay $700,000 in refunds and cancelled debts in settlement of allegations it used deceptive advertisements to promote long-term cable contracts, failed to disclose actual monthly price and terms and failed to disclose that certain fees could increase at any point.
Info Source: https://wayback.archive-it.org/1101/20181226112947/https://www.mass.gov/news/comcast-to-pay-700000-in-refunds-and-cancel-debts-for-more-than-20000-massachusetts-customers

Description: Comcast agreed to pay $1 million as part of a settlement over allegations its advertising and marketing practices for cable tv, internet and telephone services were deceptive or unfair.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20060425180055/http://www.ago.state.ma.us/sp.cfm?pageid=986&id=1633

Description: The California Attorney General and the Alameda County District Attorney announced a settlement with Comcast Cable Communications LLC to resolve allegations that it both unlawfully disposed of hazardous waste and discarded records without first omitting or redacting private customer information. As part of the settlement, Comcast agreed to pay a total of $25.95 million.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-kamala-d-harris-announces-2595-million-settlement-comcast-over
Attorney General Reaches $150,000 Settlement with Comcast, US States News, August 29, 2008 (via Nexis).

Description: The California Public Utilities Commission approved a $33.4 million settlement agreement that resolved all issues regarding the unauthorized disclosure and publication of non-published directory listing information (i.e., name, telephone number, and address) of approximately 75,000 customers by Comcast Phone of California, LLC and its related entities.
Info Source: https://docs.cpuc.ca.gov/PublishedDocs/Published/G000/M154/K457/154457136.PDF
